title: Hop River
text:
The Hop River is a river that runs through <a href="Tolland%20County%2C%20Connecticut">Tolland County</a>, <a href="Connecticut">Connecticut</a>. The Hop River's <a href="marsh">marsh</a>y source is just southeast of <a href="Bolton%20Notch%2C%20Connecticut">Bolton Notch</a>, <a href="Connecticut">Connecticut</a>. It flows for about to its <a href="confluence">confluence</a> with the <a href="Willimantic%20River">Willimantic River</a>. There is a popular <a href="Watercraft%20paddling">paddling</a> route beginning where the <a href="Skungamaug%20River">Skungamaug River</a> enters the Hop River just north of the Hendee Road bridge and ending at the <a href="Willimantic%20River">Willimantic River</a>. Most of this route consists of quick-water, but a few Class I and Class II <a href="whitewater">whitewater</a> areas exist.
The <a href="Hop%20River%20State%20Park%20Trail">Hop River State Park Trail</a> crosses the river twice and is parallel to the river for the majority of the river's length.
